P072721.project_name: Heat Reform and Building Energy Efficiency Project

keywords.cdata: air, air pollution, building energy codes, Carbon, Carbon Dioxide, central heating systems, cities, Climate Change, Coal, Construction, Cost Analysis, cost savings, District heating, district heating systems, Economic Analysis, economic development, emission reduction, emissions, end-use efficiency, Energy Conservation, energy consumption, energy demand, ENERGY EFFICIENCY, energy efficiency enforcement, energy efficiency improvements, energy efficiency policies, energy efficiency projects, energy efficiency standards, energy savings, energy sector, energy service companies, energy use, environmental impacts, environmental performance, ESCO, Exchange Rate, GEF, GLOBAL ENVIRONMENT FACILITY, HEAT, holistic approach, housing, income, innovation, insulation, international assistance, Lessons Learned, living standards, local authorities, market mechanism, marketing, Pacific Region, Partnership, policy makers, potential energy, project implementation, Project Preparation, rehabilitation, renewable energy, savings, screening, stoves, Sulfur Dioxide, sustainable development, temperature, temperature control, urban areas, urban households, valves, wall insulation, waste, watershed

project_abstract.cdata: The Heat Reform and Building Energy Efficiency Project for China aims to achieve substantial, sustained and growing increases in energy efficiency in urban residential buildings and central heating systems in China's cold climate regions. The project has the following three components: Component 1) will provide the project's first operational demonstrations that the greatest energy efficiency gains and cost savings in residential space heating can be achieved through an integrated effort that simultaneously addresses the thermal integrity of buildings, the operational efficiency of heat supply systems, the provision of means for heat control by consumers, and the implementation of heat metering, cost-based heat pricing and consumption-based heat billing. Component 2) will provide the vehicle to support the critical role of the central government to provide policy direction to localities, bring the best national and international expertise to bear on issues surrounding implementation of reform and development of new technical approaches, coordinate and guide implementation of local project activities, undertake central project management and monitoring functions, and disseminate successful ideas and results outside of participating cities. Component 3) will promote simultaneous development of both heating sector reforms and building energy efficiency improvements in 4-6 additional northern Chinese municipalities, achieving broad, national impact.

P072721.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>供热改革和建筑节能项目</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>本项目的目标是持续大幅提高中国寒冷地区城市住宅建筑和集中供热系统的能效。本项目设有三个子项目：子项目一将首次就以下内容进行示范：采用综合方式同时增强建筑的保温能力，提高供热系统的运行效率，提供消费者可自行控制用热的手段，实施用热计量、按成本计价和按用热量收费制度，可最大限度地取得节能效益并节约成本。子项目二将制定机制，支持中央政府发挥关键作用，向地方提供政策指导，集中国内和国际最优秀专业人员处理关乎供热行业改革实施和新技术方法开发的事项，协调并指导地方实施项目，履行中央项目管理和监测职能，向项目市以外的地区传播成功创意及成果。子项目三将在另外4-6个中国北方城市推动供热行业改革和开展建筑节能改造。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
